sentences.english: The number of dolphins in China is on the decline.
sentences.chinese: 我国白儅豚的数量在不断下降。

sentences.english: Thatlove can ever lose is a fact that we cannot accept as truth.
sentences.chinese: 是我们无法儅做真理来接纳的事实。

sentences.english: When you have nothing to say.
When you are still cared for.
Of course thigns from Chinese culture is popular as well.
sentences.chinese: 儅染，来自中华文化的东东也是其中之一。

sentences.english: When choosing your club, always try to find the simplest answer.
sentences.chinese: 儅你选择球杆时，总是要尝试找出最简单的答案。

definition: old variant of 騙|骗[pian4]/to get on a horse by swinging one leg over
to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
to annoy/to irritate/to be annoyed/to sulk
to gather together/to investigate/to entangle/to correct
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
to dig out/to pick out (with one's fingers)/to carve/to cut/to study meticulously/to lift one's clothes/stingy/miserly
to confer/to bestow on an inferior/to reward
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to feel attached to/to long for/to love
